snippet.title: Former hospital technician behind bogus mammogram results gets jail time
snippet.description:
* A former Georgia hospital technician was sentenced to up to six months in prison after pleading guilty to manipulating the mammogram records of 1,289 patients. Ten of those women were given false negatives, and two of them are now dead, a prosecutor says.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/16/health/georgia-false-mammogram-cancer-sentencing/index.html

snippet.title: President Obama answers questions from the media
snippet.description:
* President Barack Obama: Hello, everybody. Before I begin I just want to express on behalf of the American people our deepest condolences to the Republic of Korea, and the families of all those who've seen their loved one last when I ferry sank within the last couple of days. Obviously information is still coming in. We know that many of the victims...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/politics/obama-news-cobference-transcript/index.html

snippet.title: Mammograms: Are they needed or not?
snippet.description:
* The subject of breast cancer screening is often in the news as ongoing clinical studies publish updates and experts debate the merits of the findings.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/02/19/health/mammogram-studies/index.html

snippet.title: Long-term study questions benefits of mammogram screening
snippet.description:
* The debate over annual mammogram screenings continues this week, as follow-up data from a long-term study come under fire.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/02/12/health/mammogram-screening-benefits/index.html

snippet.title: Don't slam Canada for mammogram study
snippet.description:
* We all like to think medical care is about science, but too often it's about professional interests.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/02/19/opinion/welch-mammograms-canada/index.html

snippet.title: Breast cancer screening Qs answered
snippet.description:
* For years there has been much discussion about mammography screening. Several medical organizations have reviewed the scientific literature and made various recommendations -- to begin screening at age 40, or to begin at age 50. Some recommended screening every year; others said every two years.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/10/03/health/breast-cancer-awareness-screening/index.html

snippet.title: Breast self-exams: One way to detect breast cancer
snippet.description:
* Breast self-exams — with clinical breast exams and mammography — may help you detect breast cancer.
http://www.cnn.com/HEALTH/library/breast-self-exam/WO00026.html

snippet.title: Gupta: Smoking-breast cancer link would be a first
snippet.description:
* A California scientific panel on Monday will review a draft report showing a potential link between secondhand smoke and an increased risk of breast cancer.
http://www.cnn.com/2005/HEALTH/03/09/otsc.gupta/index.html

snippet.title: Study finds drug can help young breast cancer patients
snippet.description:
* Scientists from Oxford University reviewed clinical trials from 55 countries and found that tamoxifen helped prevent a cancer relapse for women of all ages whose tumors were sensitive to the female hormone estrogen.
http://www.cnn.com/HEALTH/9805/14/tamoxifen.works/index.html
